meanings.definition: Relating to observable characteristics or traits of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The phenotypical features of the flower include its color and size.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the phenotypical differences between various species of birds.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see how the phenotypical traits of the twins were so similar.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic style was phenotypical, standing out among the other painters.
meanings.sent5: The phenotypical markings on the butterfly's wings were truly mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the physical appearance or characteristics of an individual.
meanings.sent1: The phenotypical resemblance between the siblings was striking.
meanings.sent2: The doctor noted the phenotypical changes in the patient's skin over time.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see how the phenotypical features of the dog matched its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was phenotypical of genuine happiness, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The phenotypical differences between the two cars were immediately noticeable.
